p: Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) is a small (60–70 nm, 12 Kb), single-stranded positive-sense RNA virus in the Alphavirus genus of the Togaviridae family [ 1, 2]. Like many other arboviral diseases, chikungunya fever (CHIKF) is transmitted by mosquito vectors, primarily Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus [ 3]. CHIKF is an infectious febrile illness often accompanied by acute and chronic arthritis. The name “chikungunya” in the Makonde dialect refers to the stooped posture assumed by many patients who experience disabling joint pain [ 4].
